title: Cleveland murder scene cop captures man posing as a detective
title_page: Cleveland murder scene cop captures man posing as a detective | Daily Mail Online

Officers have released a video taken on a body camera showing a man posing as a detective at the scene of a murder in America.
Cleveland officers attended the scene to find a man wearing a tank top within the cordoned off area shining a torch on the ground.
Police from Warrensville Heights asked the man, William Mills, to state who he was and what he was doing.
He replied and said he was a detective working for the police department.
The officer asks: 'What are you doing here?' Mills answers: 'Detective.'
Officer then says: 'And you work for Warrensville Heights police department as a detective?' Mills: 'Yes, I do.'
Officer: 'And you've got a school guard crossing badge on you?' Mills: 'Yes, I do.'
Officer finally asks: 'Why do you have a school guard crossing badge if you're a detective?'
Cleveland Police found Mills had no connection to Warrensville Heights Police and he was arrested at the scene near East 150th and Harvard in Cleveland in June.
Investigators had been there following up on the murder of Michael Kidd, 20. He had been shot multiple times.
Mills claiming to be a detective at the scene of a murder in Cleveland - he admitted carrying a school crossing patrol card as his identification
Officers checked their records and found no one from Warrensville Heights police force with the name 'William Mills'
Mills was then arrested for impersonating a police officer and taken away, he later said he was only honoring a detective friend who died
Mills went to court for his arrest and he entered into a special program for low-level offenders and had his record for this case wiped clean.
Fox8 reported they had no answer at his house and he didn't return calls from journalists.
A police report shows when police questioned Mills later he told them he knew an officer who had passed away, and Mills wanted to go to the crime scene in his honor.
